fields.prayer_part2: Turning in the direction of the qibla, the Muslim raises his palms to ear level and pronounces the first takbir:
In this position, the opening dua " sana " (" Subhanaka ") is recited first. Then you should recite the formula for asking for protection from Satan. Then  the basmala is read.
fields.transcription: Subhanakallahumma wa bihamdik, ua tabaraka smook, wa ta'ala jadduk, wa la ilaha goyruk.   A'uzu billahi minash-shaitanir-rajim,   Bismillahi-r-Rahmani-r-Rahim.
fields.arab: Subhanakallahumma wa bihamdik, ua tabaraka smook, wa ta'ala jadduk, wa la ilaha goyruk.   A'uzu billahi minash-shaitanir-rajim,   Bismillahi-r-Rahmani-r-Rahim.

fields.prayer_part2: Then the worshiper recites Surah Al-Fatiha . At the end of Surah Al-Fatiha, the worshiper says “Amin” ( “Amin”  is pronounced quietly ).
fields.transcription: Surah Al-Fatiha   Al-hamdu lillahi robbil-ʼalamin Ar-Rahmanir-Rahim Maliki Yaumid-din Iyaka naʼbudu ua iyaka nasta'in Ikhdinas-syratol-mustakym Syratol-lyazina anʼamta ʼaleikhim Goiril Magdubi ʼaleihim wa yad-doooollin (Amin -  pronounced quietly )   Surah al-Kawthar   Inna a'toynakal-kausar Fasolli li robbika uanhar Inna shaniaka hual-abtar
fields.arab: Surah Al-Fatiha   Al-hamdu lillahi robbil-ʼalamin Ar-Rahmanir-Rahim Maliki Yaumid-din Iyaka naʼbudu ua iyaka nasta'in Ikhdinas-syratol-mustakym Syratol-lyazina anʼamta ʼaleikhim Goiril Magdubi ʼaleihim wa yad-doooollin (Amin -  pronounced quietly )   Surah al-Kawthar   Inna a'toynakal-kausar Fasolli li robbika uanhar Inna shaniaka hual-abtar

fields.prayer_part2: At the end of the reading of the additional sura, the worshiper pronounces the takbir: “Allahu Akbar” , and makes a bow - ruk . While in the hand, it is advisable to quietly pronounce the praise of Allah three times: “Subhana robbiyal-ʼazim . ”
fields.transcription:
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
fields.arab:
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim

fields.prayer_part2: Starting to straighten up after bowing from the waist, the worshiper says: “Sami Allahu liman hamidah” until he returns to a vertical position. Having straightened up completely, he says: “Robbana (ua) lakal-hamd . ”
fields.transcription:
Sami Allahu liman hamidah
Robbana (ua) lakal-hamd
fields.arab:
Sami Allahu liman hamidah
Robbana (ua) lakal-hamd

fields.prayer_part2: The person praying says the takbir: “Allahu Akbar ,” and first kneels down, then puts his palms down, then touches the floor with the tip of his nose, and then with his forehead. In this position, it is advisable to quietly pronounce the words of praise to Allah three times: “Subhana robbiyal-aʼla” , calmly and without haste.
fields.transcription: Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya   Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya   Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
fields.arab: Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya   Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya   Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya

fields.prayer_part2: After the sajdah, the worshiper sits down, saying “Allahu Akbar” , and remains in this position for some time.

Then the worshiper again pronounces the takbir “Allahu Akbar” and performs the second sujud. It is performed exactly the same as the first one. After the second bow to the ground, the worshiper returns to a vertical position.
fields.transcription:
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
fields.arab:
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya

fields.prayer_part2: Returning to the qyyama position, you should read:
After this, you need to read Surah Al-Fatiha , and after it - any surah or verses of the Koran.
fields.transcription: Surah Al-Fatiha   Al-hamdu lillahi robbil-ʼalamin Ar-Rahmanir-Rahim Maliki Yaumid-din Iyaka naʼbudu ua iyaka nasta'in Ikhdinas-syratol-mustakym Syratol-lyazina anʼamta ʼaleikhim Goiril Magdubi ʼaleihim wa yad-doooollin (Amin -  pronounced quietly )   Surah al-Ikhlas   Kul huallahu ahad Allahu s-somad Lam yalid wa lam yulad Wa lam yakul-lyahu kufuan ahad
fields.arab: Surah Al-Fatiha   Al-hamdu lillahi robbil-ʼalamin Ar-Rahmanir-Rahim Maliki Yaumid-din Iyaka naʼbudu ua iyaka nasta'in Ikhdinas-syratol-mustakym Syratol-lyazina anʼamta ʼaleikhim Goiril Magdubi ʼaleihim wa yad-doooollin (Amin -  pronounced quietly )   Surah al-Ikhlas   Kul huallahu ahad Allahu s-somad Lam yalid wa lam yulad Wa lam yakul-lyahu kufuan ahad

fields.prayer_part2: Having completed the reading of the second sura, the worshiper pronounces the takbir: “Allahu Akbar” , and makes a bow (hand). In the ruku position, the worshiper says three times:
fields.transcription:
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
fields.arab:
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim
Subhana robbiyal-`azim

fields.prayer_part2: Starting to straighten up after bowing from the waist, the worshiper says: “Sami Allahu liman hamidah” until he returns to a vertical position.   Having straightened up completely, he says: “Robbana (ua) lakal-hamd . ”
fields.transcription:
Sami Allahu liman hamidah
Robbana (ua) lakal-hamd
fields.arab:
Sami Allahu liman hamidah
Robbana (ua) lakal-hamd

fields.prayer_part2: Then the worshiper bows to the ground (sajdah). In this position he says three times:
fields.transcription:
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
fields.arab:
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya

fields.prayer_part2: After the sajdah, the worshiper sits down, saying “Allahu Akbar” , and remains in this position for some time.

Then the worshiper again pronounces the takbir “Allahu Akbar” and performs the second sujud. It is performed exactly the same as the first one.  After the second bow to the ground, the worshiper returns to a vertical position.
fields.transcription:
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
fields.arab:
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya
Subhana robbiyal-aʼlya

fields.prayer_part2: After making the second sajdah, the worshiper sits on his hips in the same way as in the interval between two prostrations and reads tashahhud . After reciting the tashahhud, the worshiper recites salavat . Then it is advisable to make dua in Arabic without raising your hands.   While reading the Tashahhud with the words: “ Ashhadu alla ilaha ,” the worshiper raises the index finger of his right hand and points it towards the qibla (but not up!), and lowers it with the words “ Illallah .” When raising the index finger, the thumb and middle fingers close into a ring, and the little finger and ring finger bend. When the finger is lowered, the palm should be straightened and placed in the same position (at the edge of the knee) as before the finger was raised. You should not move your index finger or keep it raised throughout the entire recitation of the Tashahhud.
fields.transcription: At-tahiyatu lillahi was-solyauatu uat-toyibat Assalamu ʼalaika ayyuhan-nabiyu wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh As-salamu ʼalaina wa ʼala ʼibadillahis-solikhin Ashhadu alla ilaha illallahu wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan abduhu wa rasulyukh   Allahumma solly ʼala Muhammad, wa ʼala ali Muhammad kama solyayta ʼala Ibrahim wa ʼala ali Ibrahim  innaka hamidum-majid Allahumma barik ʼala Muhammad wa ʼala ali Muhammad kama barakta ʼala Ibrahim wa ʼala ali Ibrahim innaka hamidum-majid.   Robbana atina fid-dunya hasanatan, wa fil-ahirati hasanatan, ua kyna ʼazaban-nar
fields.arab: At-tahiyatu lillahi was-solyauatu uat-toyibat Assalamu ʼalaika ayyuhan-nabiyu wa rahmatullahi wa barakatuh As-salamu ʼalaina wa ʼala ʼibadillahis-solikhin Ashhadu alla ilaha illallahu wa ashhadu anna Muhammadan abduhu wa rasulyukh   Allahumma solly ʼala Muhammad, wa ʼala ali Muhammad kama solyayta ʼala Ibrahim wa ʼala ali Ibrahim  innaka hamidum-majid Allahumma barik ʼala Muhammad wa ʼala ali Muhammad kama barakta ʼala Ibrahim wa ʼala ali Ibrahim innaka hamidum-majid.   Robbana atina fid-dunya hasanatan, wa fil-ahirati hasanatan, ua kyna ʼazaban-nar

fields.prayer_part2: After reading salawat and dua, the worshiper turns his head to the right and says salam (or taslim ). Then, turning his head to the left, he says salam a second time. At the same time, the worshiper looks at the edge of his shoulder.
fields.transcription:
Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullah!
Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullah!
fields.arab:
Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullah!
Assalamu alaikum wa rahmatullah!

fields.prayer_part2: At the end of the prayer, it is advisable to raise both hands to chest level. Leave a little space between them. Don't keep your hands too close to each other and don't hold them too far apart. The inside of the palms should be facing the face. Raising your hands in this way, it is advisable to say dua-istighfar .
fields.transcription:
Astaghfirullah! Astaghfirullah!
Astaghfirullah!
Allahumma antas-salaam wa minkas-salaam tabarakta
I'm zal-jalali wal-ikram
fields.arab:
Astaghfirullah! Astaghfirullah!
Astaghfirullah!
Allahumma antas-salaam wa minkas-salaam tabarakta
I'm zal-jalali wal-ikram
